links.title: EFX: What Drove Up Equifax's Stock Up 11% Today? | StockNews.com
links.description: Equifax, Inc. ( ) soared over 11% in midday trading today after providing positive guidance for the fourth quarter and next year. The stock opened this morning at $175.98 and went all the way up to $190.16 before closing the day at $184.23. This stock finished up 7.84%.

messages.body:
FireEye Stock Falls After ‘State-Sponsored’ Cyber Attack  $FEYE $MSFT $EFX $INFY $VOD 

https://newsfilter.io/a/34e9e677c575c59dda110e890e789bf3

links.title: FireEye Stock Falls After 'State-Sponsored' Cyber Attack
links.description: FireEye shares were trading sharply lower in late trading Tuesday after the security software company disclosed that it had suffered a significant cyber attack, one it blames on "a state-sponsored" group. FireEye (ticker: FEYE) said in a filing with the SEC that the discipline, operational security, and techniques used in the incident "lead us to believe it was a state-sponsored attack."

links.title: $EFX Equifax Announces SVP of Product, Data & Analytics for Consumer Business
links.description: "Product Innovation and strong analytic insight are critical to the growth of GCS and are key components of our business transformation," said Beverly Anderson, President of Global Consumer Solutions for Equifax. "Rick is the right leader to help leverage our cloud data and technology investments, and to drive new products and innovation that benefit our customers and consumers."

$EFX Equifax Announces SVP of Product, Data & Analytics for Consumer Business

links.title: Equifax Announces SVP of Product, Data & Analytics for Consumer | StockTitan.net
links.description: ATLANTA, Dec. 8, 2020 -- Equifax (NYSE: EFX) today announced the appointment of Richard (Rick) Eiel as the new Senior Vice President of Product, Data & Analytics for the Global Consumer Solutions (GCS) business unit. In the newly created role, Eiel is charged with product strategy and innovation to better meet the evolving needs of Equifax consumers.
